definition: to return/to go back
see 轉文|转文[zhuai3 wen2]
to revolve/to turn/to circle about/to walk about/classifier for revolutions (per minute etc): revs, rpm/classifier for repeated actions
to turn/to change direction/to transfer/to forward (mail)

to go/to go to (a place)/(of a time etc) last/just passed/to send/to remove/to get rid of/to reduce/to be apart from in space or time/to die (euphemism)/to play (a part)/(when used either before or after a verb) to go in order to do sth/(after a verb of motion indicates movement away from the speaker)/(used after certain verbs to indicate detachment or separation)
to rove around/to run around in circles/to walk back and forth

sentences.english: He loafed about the street looking for something to do.
sentences.chinese: 他在街上轉來轉去，想找點事做。

sentences.english: Li Busu was familiar with the route so they made rapid progress. He turned this way and that through open crevices .
sentences.chinese: 李不俗駕輕就熟，在那些嵌裂透漏的縫隙中鑽來轉去。

sentences.english: The log twiddled round and round in the river.
sentences.chinese: 那根圓木在河水中轉來轉去。
那扇沉重的門向內轉去。

sentences.english: And are you now turning away from the LORD?
sentences.chinese: 你們今日竟轉去不跟從耶和華嗎？

sentences.english: For there he can maneuver you onto all fours.
sentences.chinese: 他於是就轉來轉去，你還可以四肢趴着。

sentences.english: Sell the gold back and put the money towards a new style.
sentences.chinese: 你應該把黃金賣回去，折現轉去買新樣式。

sentences.english: His glance roved the boy sitting by the window.
sentences.chinese: 他的目光轉來轉去地看着坐在窗戶旁邊的男孩。

sentences.english: Don't stop, so the beast's upstream instead.
sentences.chinese: 轉來轉去不停止，於是石獸反而逆流而上了。

sentences.english: They both looked out through the window at the guests milling about in the yard.
sentences.chinese: 他們一起看向窗外，看着客人們在後院裏轉來轉去。

sentences.english: The thou Ao eye pupil son turns around, one slavering of face facial expression.
sentences.chinese: 古傲眼珠子轉來轉去，一臉的垂涎表情。

sentences.english: Boemio casually walks around all of it, occasionally laughing.
sentences.chinese: 波密奧在這些東西周圍轉來轉去，偶爾還笑笑。

sentences.english: Look out for cars turning in your direction.
sentences.chinese: 注意車子正往你的方向轉去。

sentences.english: Daenerys could only twist and turn beside him.
sentences.chinese: 丹妮莉絲只能在他身邊扭來轉去。

sentences.english: He turned their heart to hate his people, to deal subtilly with his servants.
sentences.chinese: 使敵人的心轉去恨他的百姓，並用詭計待他的僕人。

sentences.english: She at home roves , is excited the cheeks to be bright red.
sentences.chinese: 她在家裏轉來轉去，興奮得臉頰飛紅。

definition: to gesticulate/to point out/to point the finger of blame
to come to sb's door/to call on sb
rumor
accidentally/to act before thinking
to be of no interest to anyone (idiom)
to change one's mind/to go back on one's word
like a swarm of bees/everyone swarms around pushing and shouting/a hornet's nest
to turn back/to put back/reversal/melodic inversion (in music)
to make progress/progress
main job/day job/steady full-time job (as opposed to temporary or casual)/chief or principal post (as opposed to deputy)
to try to persuade sb to give up (their job, plans etc)
not to engage in honest work/to ignore one's proper occupation/not to attend to one's proper duties
aloof/indifferent/unconcerned
pediatrics/pediatric (department)/sth of little importance/trifle/a child's play/(slang) childish/petty/stingy
profession/role (acting)
to count/reckoning
